unnormalised: Hey there! Someone asked about good venues for a wedding reception in Gurgaon, right? Well, it really depends on your budget and the number of guests. For a smaller, more intimate gathering (say, 100-150 people), places like The Oberoi Gurgaon (Udyog Vihar, Phase V) or Trident Gurgaon (443, Udyog Vihar Phase V) offer excellent banquet halls and service. They're a bit on the pricier side though, expect to shell out Rs. 5000+ per plate.

unnormalised: If you're looking for something mid-range, with space for a larger crowd (300-500 guests), check out venues around Sector 29. Several good options are available there. Also, consider farmhouses along Sohna Road. Many of them have amazing outdoor spaces, perfect for a grand reception. A good landmark there would be near GD Goenka World School, Sohna-Gurgaon Road. The rental cost varies drastically though, so do your homework. You should budget around ₹3000-₹4000 per plate here.

unnormalised: Finally, always visit the venue in person before booking! Check the accessibility, parking facilities (important in Gurgaon!), and catering options. Make sure the address provided on Google Maps is accurate (sometimes it isn't!). Look for complete addresses like "Plot No. 123, Sector 44, Gurgaon, Haryana, 122003" before settling on anything. Good luck with the wedding!
